intro: Elsota lanceolata, commonly known as the narrowleaf elsota, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Elsota lanceolata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
